column4: I'm having trouble ejecting an external drive.  When I look at File Browser/Computer, I see it in the places list and name list.  Trying to eject by name, it says it's writing do it, do not remove it.  But when I right-click on it in the places list, mount is the only option offered.  Does this mean it's not mounted and I can, in fact, remove it?
get a paperclip and force it open
jam the paperclip in the little hole on the bottom right
It's not a cdrom... it's an external harddrive, I just unplug it.  But I need to make certain that ubuntu has written what it needs to to it, before I pull it.
